#:
Lerna is a tool used in JavaScript monorepo projects. The lerna.json file is
used to configure lerna to to best fit your project.

?ignore.#: An array of globs that won't be bootstrapped when running "lerna bootstrap" command.

?npmClientArgs.#: Array of strings that will be passed as arguments directly to "npm install" during the "lerna bootstrap" command.

?exact.#: Use lerna 1.x behavior of "exact" comparison. It will enforce the exact match for all subsequent executions.

?ignoreChanges.#: An array of globs that won't be included in "lerna changed/publish". Use this to prevent publishing of a new version unnecessarily for changes, such as fixing a README.md typo.

?message.#: A custom commit message when performing version updates for publication. See https://github.com/lerna/lerna/tree/master/commands/version#--message-msg for more information.

?npmClient.#: Which npm client should be used when running package scripts.

?allowBranch.#: A whitelist of globs that match git branches where "lerna version" is enabled.

?message.#: A custom commit message when performing version updates for publication. See https://github.com/lerna/lerna/tree/master/commands/version#--message-msg for more information.

?ignoreChanges.#: Array of globs of files to ignore when detecting changed packages.

?npmClient.#: Specify which client to run commands with (change to "yarn" to run commands with yarn. Defaults to "npm".

?npmClientArgs.#: Array of strings that will be passed as arguments to the npmClient.

?packages.#: Array of globs to use a package locations.

?useWorkspaces.#: Enable workspaces integration when using Yarn.

?version.#: The current version of the repository (or independent).

?workspaces.#: Array of globs to use a workspace locations.
